name: liltingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
rising and falling in a way that is pleasant to listen to: The audience hummed along to the duet, which was liltingly played by the orchestra under their conductor James Conlon. Track 3 is a liltingly melancholic number called Soldier.
More examplesFewer examplesThe music was liltingly performed by a six-piece onstage ensemble.The ever-modest player remains as articulate, as liltingly romantic, as poetic as his football used to be.The series is liltingly narrated over an Irish music soundtrack.
